2.  [Noloco Tables](https://guides.noloco.io/data/collections)

## Import a file

Create a Noloco table from a file

If you already have your data in a CSV file, you can use that file to automatically create a corresponding Noloco table. We will automatically derive the field types, import your data, and even create the most appropriate view for the data in your app.

Create a table by importing a CSV file

To get started, select 'Import a file' from the data source menu:

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fobo2BT3qKKbd9A7wLsbt%252FImport%2520file.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D695636c2-3dd0-495b-b221-985ba3c3ddc6&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=df878577&sv=2)

You will then see the import modal appear, where you can first name the table:

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FNE0cgsn1KRvqFmWSgHu2%252FImport%2520CSV.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1217f58f-907e-414b-aa35-111f14318663&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a8c04456&sv=2)

Then, you can simply drop your CSV file, and we will automatically derive the structure for the table:

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FbPwsalZ2BmHD7IufBVgO%252FNov-17-2023%252011-20-01.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ded38e87d-a670-4ef0-81f1-b62218e700cf&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7906d6a4&sv=2)

At this point, you can click on the column headings to either exclude or change the type of any fields. Once you're done, just click 'Import' and we will set everything up.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FVzsHmV7q7JnfDrKf8ZCj%252FScreenshot%25202023-11-17%2520at%252011.22.23.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7af68f61-7e27-4343-90ff-63aefee948d7&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=fe7c63e4&sv=2)

### 

Troubleshooting

#### 

Why is the 'Import' button is greyed out?

This likely indicates that you have left the table name with its default value, creating a conflict with a previous import. Alternatively, it might mean you've renamed the table, and this name also conflicts with an existing table.

# Creating a Noloco AI Column

1.  [🔗Data Sources](https://guides.noloco.io/data)
2.  [Noloco Tables](https://guides.noloco.io/data/collections)

AI-powered columns that bring intelligence to your tables by using AI to perform tasks like classification, summarization, sentiment analysis, grammar correction and more

### 

**What is Noloco AI?**

Noloco AI-powered columns bring intelligence to your data by leveraging advanced AI models to perform tasks like classification, summarization, sentiment analysis, grammar correction, keyword extraction, and custom operations using chat prompts.

With Noloco AI, you can automate data analysis, improve workflow efficiency, and enhance the overall usability of your tables.

### 

**How to Add an AI-Powered Column**

Follow these simple steps to add an AI-powered column to your Noloco table:

**Navigate to Your Table**: Open the data table where you'd like to add the AI-powered column.

**Click ‘New Field’**: Select the option to create a new column.

Provide a descriptive name for the new field

**Select Field Type**: Choose **AI Powered** as the field type.

**Choose an Operation**: Select from the following operations:

*   **Classify**: Categorize data based on predefined options.
    
*   **Summarize**: Condense lengthy text into concise summaries.
    
*   **Sentiment**: Determine the emotional tone of the text.
    
*   **Chat Prompt**: Use custom prompts to generate tailored outputs.
    
*   **Correct Grammar**: Refine text for grammatical accuracy.
    
*   **Keyword Extraction**: Identify relevant keywords from the input text.
    

**Provide Input Text**: Depending on the operation, define the input text to the AI model

*   **Static Text**: Fixed phrases or instructions.
    
*   **Dynamic Content**: References to other fields in the row. Use the **field tokens** for easy selection.
    

Creating a Noloco AI Column

### 

**Supported Operations**

#### 

**Classify**

Automatically categorize data based on specific criteria. Use predefined options to sort or group data effortlessly.

*   **Description**: Assign categories to your data using static or dynamic inputs. Customize the output type as single or multiple options and define your categories for precision.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Classify maintenance issues based on descriptions.
        
    *   **Input**: "Forklift overheating"
        
    *   **Output**: Urgent
        
    

#### 

**Summarize**

Condense lengthy or complex information into short, meaningful summaries.

*   **Description**: Simplify raw text or row values into concise outputs, saving time and improving data clarity.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Summarize incident reports for quick review.
        
    *   **Input**: “Machine A stopped due to overheating after prolonged use.”
        
    *   **Output**: “Machine A overheated during use.”
        
    

#### 

**Sentiment**

Gauge the emotional tone of text to prioritize and address issues effectively.

*   **Description**: Analyze text to determine if it’s positive, negative, or neutral. Define sentiment categories that align with your use case.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Analyze employee feedback for morale.
        
    *   **Input**: “Workload is overwhelming, but team support is excellent.”
        
    *   **Output**: Negative
        
    

#### 

**Chat Prompt**

Leverage custom prompts to perform a variety of tasks tailored to your needs.

*   **Description**: Design specific prompts and define the expected output type (text, date, boolean, or number). Use this flexible operation for creative and diverse use cases.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Generate personalized email responses.
        
    *   **Input**: "Dear \[Customer Name\], thank you for reaching out regarding \[Issue\]."
        
    *   **Output**: Polished email draft tailored to the customer.
        
    

#### 

**Correct Grammar**

Ensure professional communication by refining text for grammatical accuracy.

*   **Description**: Transform informal or error-prone text into polished, client-ready outputs.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Refine internal quality control logs.
        
    *   **Input**: “batch fail tests bcoz contamination.”
        
    *   **Output**: “Batch failed tests due to contamination.”
        
    

Identify the most relevant keywords from your data for actionable insights.

*   **Description**: Extract important terms from raw text to uncover trends or guide decision-making.
    
*   **Example**:
    
    *   **Task**: Analyze customer feedback for marketing campaigns.
        
    *   **Input**: “Great durability and affordable price; lacks color options.”
        
    *   **Output**: “Durability, affordable price, color options”
        
    

### 

**Best Practices for Effective Prompts**

*   **Be Clear and Specific**: Use precise language to avoid ambiguity.
    
*   **Keep It Relevant**: Ensure input text is closely aligned with the operation’s purpose.
    
*   **Leverage Structure**: Break down complex prompts into logical components.
    
*   **Test and Iterate**: Regularly review outputs and refine prompts as needed.
    

### 

**Key Tips for Using Noloco AI**

*   **Dynamic Text Integration**: Combine static text with references to other fields using **tokens** in the input box.
    
*   **Preview Ideas**: Although Noloco currently doesn’t show resolved dynamic text, double-check your inputs for clarity.
    
*   **No Length Limits**: Feel free to craft prompts as long as necessary, but structured prompts often yield better results.
    

### 

FAQs about Noloco AI

**When do AI columns regenerate?**[](#when-do-ai-columns-regenerate)

AI-powered columns automatically regenerate whenever the input data for a row changes. This ensures that the output remains up-to-date and aligned with the latest data in your table.

**How much does Noloco AI cost?**[](#how-much-does-noloco-ai-cost)

While Noloco AI is in beta, it is completely free to use! You can explore its powerful features without any additional cost or the need for your own OpenAI API key.

**How many rows can Noloco AI process?**[](#how-many-rows-can-noloco-ai-process)

Noloco AI can process as many rows as your table contains. There are no specific limits, but performance may vary with very large datasets. For optimal use, test with your data volume and let us know if you encounter any bottlenecks.

**Does Noloco AI work on synced data tables?**[](#does-noloco-ai-work-on-synced-data-tables)

Currently, Noloco AI is exclusively available on [**Noloco Tables**](https://guides.noloco.io/data/collections). It does not support synced data tables from integrations like [Airtable](https://guides.noloco.io/data/airtable).

**Can I use dynamic and static text together in prompts?**[](#can-i-use-dynamic-and-static-text-together-in-prompts)

Yes, you can seamlessly combine static text with dynamic content by referencing other fields in the row using tokens. This allows for highly customized and context-aware AI outputs.

**Can I preview how AI processes my inputs?**[](#can-i-preview-how-ai-processes-my-inputs)

At the moment, Noloco does not offer a preview of how combined static and dynamic text will appear after processing. It’s recommended to double-check your input for clarity and accuracy.

**Are there limits on the length of input text or prompts?**[](#are-there-limits-on-the-length-of-input-text-or-prompts)

No, there are currently no length limitations for input text or prompts. However, concise and structured inputs often produce more accurate results.

**What types of data can Noloco AI process?**[](#what-types-of-data-can-noloco-ai-process)

Noloco AI works best with text data but can also generate various outputs depending on the operation:

*   Text
    
*   Numbers
    
*   Dates
    
*   Boolean values (True/False)
    

**Can I create multiple AI-powered columns in one table?**[](#can-i-create-multiple-ai-powered-columns-in-one-table)

Yes, you can create as many AI-powered columns as needed in a single table. Each column can have its own operation, tailored to your specific workflow or analysis needs.

**How do I troubleshoot incorrect outputs?**[](#how-do-i-troubleshoot-incorrect-outputs)

*   Review your prompt for clarity and alignment with the operation’s purpose.
    

*   Ensure the input text (static and dynamic) is formatted correctly.
    

*   Test different variations of the prompt to refine results.
    

**What operations does Noloco AI support?**[](#what-operations-does-noloco-ai-support)

Noloco AI supports six operations:

*   Classify
    
*   Summarize
    
*   Sentiment
    
*   Chat Prompt
    
*   Correct Grammar
    
*   Keyword Extraction
    

Each operation has unique use cases tailored to various workflows.

**Will Noloco AI support integrations in the future?**[](#will-noloco-ai-support-integrations-in-the-future)

While Noloco AI currently focuses on Noloco Tables, future updates may include compatibility with synced tables from external platforms like Airtable. Stay tuned for announcements!

### 

**Getting Started**

Noloco AI is currently free to use while in beta. Start creating smarter workflows and unlocking insights with AI-powered columns today!

# Airtable | Noloco

1.  [🔗Data Sources](https://guides.noloco.io/data)

Learn how to build an app in Noloco around your Airtable base

### 

**Overview**

If you're storing data in Airtable, you can easily connect any of your Airtable bases to your Noloco apps. This allows your team or customers to read, update and create records in Airtable directly from your Noloco app.

In this guide you will learn how to [Connect your Airtable account](https://guides.noloco.io/data/airtable#connect-your-airtable-account)to your Noloco Account and how to [Connect your Airtable base](https://guides.noloco.io/data/airtable#connect-your-airtable-base)to your Noloco project.

### 

**Connect your Airtable account**

**Start the connect flow from your integration settings**

Go to your app settings and open the _**Integrations & API keys**_ page, from there find the Airtable integration and click _**Connect**_.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F0Hjhjqi7g1OXMNvwnIVr%252Fimage%2520%2827%29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7d926bd3-8aad-4e01-8f6c-8f8f7a0dc947&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=690d7e9d&sv=2)

**Grant Noloco access to all of the bases you want to be shared.**

Select all of the bases that you want Noloco to have access to and then click Authorize. There are a couple of important things here to note:

*   If you have previously connected Airtable bases with your personal API key and sharing link (i.e. the legacy Airtable integration) you must select all of these bases in addition to new bases you are adding. Failure to do this will stop these old bases from being synced.
    
*   One option to avoid not having access to future bases is to select "All current and future bases in this workspace", however if you do this just be aware that Noloco does then have access to all of your bases in the workspace.
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fosh7EDZT9KSzExhQYhsI%252FNoloco%2520is%2520requesting%2520Airtable%2520access.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3b24b640-23f8-4989-b9fe-233cc7f48395&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=b403584a&sv=2)

**Review the accessible bases on your integration settings in Noloco.**

Here you will see a list of bases that you have shared with Noloco over OAuth along with any bases connected to Noloco already. Any bases that are connected to Noloco with a Permission Level of `none` are not being synced and you should grant Noloco access to them via your third-party integration settings on [airtable.com](https://airtable.com/).

To review the bases that have granted access to Noloco, click on **View Accessible Bases** in the Airtable integration.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FE5hlE3NrIhqnKuCtR4cS%252FView%2520Accessible%2520Bases%2520Airtable.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D37652e05-d58c-4f74-87a8-85959a344ec5&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a48715f9&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FQFJWg78GzArk7b2zMevM%252FAccessible%2520Bases%2520Airtable.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1856f0d8-3a8f-4327-956f-67acfa0f1987&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d5a471e1&sv=2)

### 

**Connect your Airtable base**

**Add your Airtable data source**

Navigate to the data tab in your Noloco app and click to add a new data source. From the list, choose Airtable.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FM9mMD1zNSxJrVefK3bAP%252FAdd%2520your%2520Airtable%2520data%2520source.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D36183a6f-1eaa-4064-b5a1-5d75a06bcbdd&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=ed73d540&sv=2)

**Find and select your base from the dropdown**

All of the bases you have shared with Noloco via OAuth will be in this dropdown, if any are missing go to your third-party integrations on [airtable.com](https://airtable.com/), find Noloco and grant it access to the required bases.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FxPe1zCnLQLxgO4xtG3Ps%252FSelect%2520your%2520base%2520from%2520the%2520dropdown.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D87987aee-99c8-45f2-85fc-3e789be833c9&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=1b73fbc&sv=2)

**Name your data source**

It's best practice to give your data source in Noloco the same name your base has in Airtable to help you keep track of everything. Once you've entered all this information from Airtable, click _**Next**_.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FwZFcYA5s76p0ldN28IHm%252FName%2520your%2520data%2520source.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5d3bc25a-5407-4eb6-acf2-e27bf6d84cb0&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=c666f3cb&sv=2)

### 

Bring me to my app

Noloco will analyse the data in your Airtable base and will automatically create tables and views in your app around your data from Airtable.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F7ANmhOy9qe2IInVSTDGc%252FImport%2520Complete.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9e652bc5-60d9-4f70-8919-494f2abb8853&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=727aa7bd&sv=2)

For example, if you have a table with Properties data in Airtable, we'll automatically create a collection list view, record view to edit individual records and a form to add new Properties data. You can then use our App Builder to configure the display, add filters and set user access levels (i.e. which users can see and update what information).

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FOk8P3p3im8639a6a0Maj%252FProperties%2520Collection.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D86d6a6d7-5f00-45f6-b4b2-6f130ec63881&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=b65f2f8b&sv=2)

### 

Supported field types

The field types in Airtable can be broken down into the types that we fully support, types that we support reading (but not updating) and types we do not support and exclude from syncs.

#### 

Fully supported field types

The following field types are fully supported by Noloco, both to display in your app and be updated by it.

`singleCollaborator`, `multipleCollaborators`

#### 

Field types supported only for reading

These field types will be imported into your Noloco app to be displayed, but cannot be updated by your app.

`lookup`, `multipleLookupValues`

#### 

Field types that are not supported

Any types that do not appear in one of the two sections above are not supported by Noloco. These fields will never be imported into your apps. A summary of these fields follows but please note that it may be non-exhaustive if Airtable adds new field types in the future.

If you are using Airtable user fields in your base and want to import these to Noloco, we would recommend setting up a user table which has a single user per-row and information about the user in field types which are supported by Noloco. You can then import this table as a [user list](https://guides.noloco.io/settings/user-lists).

#### 

Synced Tables are not supported

Please note that where you have a synced table in Airtable (i.e. records in Base A and synced to records in Base B) we don't support updating the records in this table. This is due to the fact that the records in each base have unique record IDs. We do support disabling certain fields from syncing, by using the sync menu on each table which in many cases negates the need for a synced base in the first place. Please reach out to our Support team if this is something you require assistance with.

### 

FAQs

**How often does my data get synced?**[](#how-often-does-my-data-get-synced)

When your users update data from Noloco, it will be reflected _instantly_ in your Airtable base.

If an update is made directly to your Airtable base for example, via an automation, then updated data should be reflected in Noloco in less than 2 minutes.

**Can I connect multiple Airtable bases to one Noloco app?**[](#can-i-connect-multiple-airtable-bases-to-one-noloco-app)

Yes - you can connect multiple Airtable bases to the same Noloco app. You can also mix and match with other data sources like Noloco Tables or Google Sheets as well.

**Why isn't my Airtable base appearing in the dropdown to connect?**[](#why-isnt-my-airtable-base-appearing-in-the-dropdown-to-connect)

This is caused by one of two scenarios:

1.  **Your base is already connected to this app.** You can check this by going to your data page and looking for the base, or by going to your project integration settings and reviewing the accessible bases modal which will show you the bases which are connected from your account.
    
2.  **Noloco doesn't have access to this base from your OAuth integration.** To fix this you can check the bases that Noloco has access to by going to your project integration settings and opening the accessible Airtable bases modal. If your base does not appear in this list you have not given Noloco permission to access it. You can grant permission by going to [your Airtable third-party integration settings](https://support.airtable.com/docs/third-party-integrations-via-oauth-overview#managing-integrations) and adding the base to your Noloco integration.
    

**How do I grant Noloco access to particular bases from within Airtable?**[](#how-do-i-grant-noloco-access-to-particular-bases-from-within-airtable)

Follow these steps to get to your third-party integration settings in Airtable and to ensure Noloco has access to the relevant Airtable base(s) on your account.

1.  Click on your account icon in the top right corner
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F442jwWCUqbruzV88OvFf%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D57994a16-4ed2-4267-919b-975949a10bfd&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=803b21b9&sv=2)

1.  Click on Integrations and choose _**Third-party integrations**_
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FD17l8K3UTUb8GKAtj6d9%252FThird%2520party%2520intergrations.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df45bb779-e293-4452-acea-da2cf5a45e25&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=18f50974&sv=2)

1.  Click into the Noloco integration and review the Workspaces and Bases that Noloco has access to.
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fwv49fuHJlfUJ6gPQZ74x%252FGrant%2520Access%2520to%2520base%2520Airtable.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D809c2539-cfd6-49f2-aa14-609cf037ac50&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f4305003&sv=2)

1.  If necessary, you can _**Add a base**_ to ensure that Noloco has sufficient access to a particular Airtable base for your app.
    

**Why won't one of my fields sync**?[](#why-wont-one-of-my-fields-sync)

If you have tried doing a [manual sync of your Base's schema](https://guides.noloco.io/data/data-overview/syncing#manually-syncing-a-data-source-schema) but one of your fields still won't appear in Noloco this can mean one of two things:

*   **We don't support that type of field** See the [section above](https://guides.noloco.io/data/airtable#field-types-that-are-not-supported) on which field types are and aren't supported.
    
*   **The name of the field clashes with a previous name of an existing column** If you ever renamed a column and now the new field has the same name as that older column we will not be able to sync that field to Noloco until the older, existing field is deleted, or the new field's name is changed in any way.
    

Why won't my Synced Table records update?[](#why-wont-my-synced-table-records-update)

While we can read data from an Airtable synced table, Noloco does not support _updating_ records in synced tables. This is due to the fact that the records in each base have unique record IDs and updates can't be done via the Airtable API.

You can however disable certain fields from syncing, by using the sync menu on each table which in many cases negates the need for a synced table in the first place.

**Why is my formula field being synced as the wrong type?**[](#why-is-my-formula-field-being-synced-as-the-wrong-type)

Sometimes Airtable will choose different default formatting to Noloco for formula fields. For instance a formula field that is formatted as an integer in Airtable may appear as a decimal when synced to Noloco.

If this happens to one of your fields there is a simple fix to force Airtable to tell us about how we should format the field:

1.  **Open up the type configuration for your formula field in Airtable**
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FUPzQXWM0gY4DdalPFnrM%252FFormula%2520field%2520settings.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D1b18f584-f340-4e60-850e-5018802cfd3f&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d08e607d&sv=2)

**2\. Navigate to the formatting options**

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FM58sDWQAZW5ybqZNkRHR%252FFormula%2520field%2520formatting%2520options.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db5159fcf-3851-4cba-8534-b80f1a312915&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=bfa5fdb1&sv=2)

**3\. Click save** Make sure to save the settings even if the selected format is what you currently see on Airtable; this will make Airtable explicitly tell Noloco how to format your field.

**Why is my lookup field being synced without its formatting?**[](#why-is-my-lookup-field-being-synced-without-its-formatting)

If your lookup field is based on a multi-relationship field (either many-to-many or one-to-many), when we sync it into Noloco we will convert it to a `TEXT` field and sync its contents as a comma-delimited list of values. The reason for this is that Noloco does not support array or collection types, except for relationships. At the same time we want to make sure that you can see all data for a field displayed in it. To achieve this balance we convert these fields to comma-delimited lists and store the raw data from Airtable inside them, meaning you won't see your formatting applied.

Lookups based on single relationships (one-to-one or many-to-one) will be synced as their underlying type with any formatting brought along. If you need formatting to be applied to a multi-lookup we recommend you look at your data model to see if you can use relationship or single-lookup fields instead.

**How do I reset my Airtable Connection?**[](#how-do-i-reset-my-airtable-connection)

If you want to completely reset your connection to Airtable you can try to reconnect to your Airtable account. This can be done through your apps Integrations & API Keys Settings

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FmL0k3KRvei31W7LHmu1U%252Fairtable_reconnect.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D81c36839-d35f-439d-a90a-059d50f4b6c4&width=300&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7a39859d&sv=2)

1.  Go to _Settings > Integrations & API Keys_ on the left menu.
    
2.  Scroll down to _Airtable_ and click on _Reconnect._
    
3.  Click on + _Add a base._
    
4.  Locate the workspace and select _All current and future bases in this workspace._
    
5.  Click on _Grant access._
    

Give it a minute or two to allow the syncing process to complete. If you still see the table has not synced the latest changes, kick off a [manual sync](https://guides.noloco.io/data/data-overview/syncing#manually-syncing-a-table), and that should do it.

# Public Forms | Noloco

1.  [📝Forms](https://guides.noloco.io/forms)

Collect data from anyone

Public Forms allow you to create a web form with a shareable URL that allows anyone to submit new records to a collection without logging in to your Noloco app.

### 

Enabling Public Forms For a Collection

To enable public forms for a collection, simply click the "enable public forms" toggle in the Edit Mode sidebar for the "create new record" page for any collection.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FMEeKP6QbErOrE4Y8COmO%252FpFormsToggle.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dee70aee8-71ff-41f4-856f-b7c8d5fc7291&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=cb09a299&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FL9hgdNZYsWvjfaMtVNN8%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd49c7350-69fc-4435-a42e-4c844fe9c546&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f537e27&sv=2)

### 

Setting a Custom Success Message

Users will see a short thank you message when they successfully complete a form. While there is a default message, you can customize this message by filling in the "On Submit Message" textbox.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FYFHKi0ifIMRCCz9CioRO%252FonSubmitDemo.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D90b7ee56-da0f-4aef-a7ff-40e5d9c5694d&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=83d24b0f&sv=2)

Setting an On Submit Message

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FacM047XtofMzAlnIh7li%252FFromSubmissionResult.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D6395407f-d1d3-467a-b7ab-11512ee24c27&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f98039f9&sv=2)

How Users See an On Submit Message

### 

Distributing a Public Form

Simply copy the public form URL from the "Public Forms" menu. This URL can then be distributed to users who will be able to fill out the form without logging in.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F33prdfumhm1zdplqGJeb%252FcopyAndPastePFormUrl.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D9bd58d11-8aa6-4eb2-9159-aa60838a941c&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=6b50ecf3&sv=2)

Copy and Paste the URL

### 

Deleting a Public Form

If you want to delete the public form associated with a collection, you can do so immediately by clicking the "enable public form" toggle again.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FngB2sblgj10alPtTYCu4%252FdisablePFormToggle.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D132b82c6-7f43-444a-b8dd-e4cee39acbbe&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=3bb485d5&sv=2)

Click the Toggle to Disable Public Forms

**Note** If you delete a public form for a collection, existing public form links will be permanently broken, even if you later re-enable public forms for that same collection.

### 

Workflows

Any workflows that are triggered by adding a record to a collection, will also be triggered if a public form is submitted for that collection.

# E-Signature In Action Button

1.  [📝Forms](https://guides.noloco.io/forms)
2.  [Forms](https://guides.noloco.io/forms/forms)

## E-Signature Fields

The E-signature input in Noloco allows users to capture signatures directly within your app. This feature can be used on both desktop and mobile devices, making it versatile and accessible.

### 

Using E-Signature fields in Noloco

Noloco Basics ┃ Using E-Signature Fields in Noloco - YouTube

### 

**Enabling E-signature Input**

1.  **Navigate to your Form or Action button**
    
2.  Open the settings of the field in your form you wish to turn into an E-signature input.
    
3.  Change the **Display As** option to "**E-Signature**" in the form field settings.
    

E-Signature In Action Button

### 

**Signature Input Options**

When enabled, users can choose from three methods to provide their signature:

#### 

**Draw**:

Users can draw their signature using a mouse or touch screen.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FAXoXpAfHcsSk2KgRlQHI%252Fsignature-draw.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbc547ed2-d6fa-4b46-a2eb-aca0f7b06a8d&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=67cda8c5&sv=2)

#### 

**Type**:

Users can type their name, and it will be converted into a handwritten style.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FgKo7XsLbTSWjwTuILwnS%252Fsignature-type.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0d641ccb-a041-4a6d-b77b-3ec1b82ae7ae&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=1219d701&sv=2)

#### 

**Upload**:

Users can upload an image of their signature.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FrRh8ipUSjQhkRUuY6B14%252Fsignature-upload.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D73d0fafe-ddd7-4ff2-9819-013eee12639d&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=bbcdec34&sv=2)

### 

**When can you use the E-Signature Input?**

*   **New Record Creation**: Capture signatures when users create new records.
    
*   **Action Buttons**: Use in action buttons to update records, such as signing off on orders or invoices.
    

### 

**Example: Sign Action Button**

Create a "Sign" action button that opens a modal, allowing users to provide their signature to approve an order or invoice.

[Learn more about action buttons](https://guides.noloco.io/actions/action-buttons)

# Overview | Noloco

1.  [📃Record Pages](https://guides.noloco.io/record-pages)

Turn a row in your spreadsheet into a beautiful user-friendly record page 💥

As you will have learned from our guide on [Collection Displays](https://guides.noloco.io/collections/display), once you connect your data source we will automatically spin up **record pages** and forms to add new records.

Noloco Basics ┃ Editing Record Views - YouTube

Each row in a collection view links to a record page view that can showcase a lot more details about that record. You can add and customize sections on a record page view to display the data and fields of your records, including related collections, highlights, charts and fields which allow you and your team to edit your records.

To navigate to the record page simply click on the collection item as shown in the screenshot below.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FtCQi6IYfumiCrdUYrswk%252FCollection%2520View.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D994176de-12f2-4acc-9938-7e1516002bf6&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a911d51e&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FfDEiNFp1cVejo6Ahvf6f%252FRecord%2520Page.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dc8d7830c-82e3-49e6-8a2e-74c24213443b&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=76bd9316&sv=2)

To edit the Record page, simply toggle on edit mode.

For the entirety of the page, you can choose to customise the;

*   ✍️ Header title for the Record Page
    
*   🔏 The Edit & Done button text
    

*   📂 Add tabs
    
    *   Allows you to create different sections on the same record page. This can help to reduce page length and organise information by logical groupings
        
    

The Header Title can be any text field from the record or the Noloco UUID (see below)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FEVHeC3EVBbvBzaJBe1IP%252FScreenshot%25202022-10-14%2520at%252018.16.13.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db8db8fc9-d1d3-4f9b-9a53-69b107b94340&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d7162f10&sv=2)

### 

🖌 Record Page Components

Once you navigate to your automatically created Record page, you might want to tweak the design or choose different fields to display. You can do this by modifying the existing components on the page or by adding in some new ones.

**To add a new component** to your record page, simply enter into edit mode (cmd + e) or (ctrl + e) to access the list of components. The list will be visible **at the bottom of the record page** so make sure to scroll to the bottom.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F9ZN4z0HOrBu2BRFb9hKu%252FScreenshot%25202022-10-14%2520at%252018.03.08.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D0e1e6a21-7051-4328-9644-f56342b6029e&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=e37c5c09&sv=2)

Select the component you would like to add

To modify an existing component, simply click on the section you wish to modify (once in edit mode). Once selected you will gain access to the editor menu on the left hand side (see screenshot below) where you can customise it further.

For example, when you highlight the details components you can customise the Title, the subtitle and the fields that are on display.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FLhEUVMaDZsaIFAvcUZgM%252FScreenshot%25202022-10-14%2520at%252018.10.16.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De2604e3c-1a85-4324-a486-13f7ecddc641&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=7138eeee&sv=2)

Each record page component has slightly different customisation capabilities depending on the component type you choose.

# Visibility Settings | Noloco

1.  [📃Record Pages](https://guides.noloco.io/record-pages)

Visibility settings by User Type, User Roles and Custom rule conditions

Noloco Basics ┃Setting Page Visibility Rules - YouTube

### 

Table of Contents

### 

Where can I access Visibility Settings?

Builders can access the visibility settings for collection views & record page components across their app when in **edit mode**. As a builder toggle on edit mode or press (cmd + e) for Macbooks or (ctrl+e) for Windows to access these settings.

**Collection View visibility settings** _(show / hide views from the sidebar)_

First select the collection you wish to access from the sidebar, then enter into edit mode. Once in edit mode you can access the visibility settings for a Collection view as seen in the screenshot below.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FckE2ECYLna4MYbLQzRCC%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-27%2520at%252015.36.41.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D752b0a36-9833-45f6-b24a-753c796756b2&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f16a5786&sv=2)

Once selected press (cmd or ctrl +e)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fudj6UAHyj49n8f0inKnJ%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-27%2520at%252015.33.17.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df77f652c-8661-45ff-9bcb-8ed0bdbffe67&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=55e8a365&sv=2)

(click image to expand) Select the visibility section from the sidebar

**Record Page Component visibility settings**

Once you are viewing the correct record page, enter into edit mode (cmd / ctrl + e). Select the component on the page you wish to apply a visibility setting on. In the below example, I have selected the **Highlights** component visible on the Team record page for Mark Zuckerberg. Once selected, access the Visibility section highlighted in the screenshot below.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fe59XmnEavEh0YIDEZZtv%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-27%2520at%252015.40.38.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De36481ba-6943-43a3-a3f8-a3f88be514c1&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=1183b248&sv=2)

### 

What Visibility Settings options can I use?

There are 3 visibility settings options you can use to determine what elements of the UI a User can see. These are:

1.  Type of User
    
2.  User Roles
    
3.  Custom Rules
    

### 

Visibility Setting: Type of User

The Team Member flag setting on a User Role determines whether they are deemed an **Internal User or an External User**.

If Team Member = true they are considered an internal user, If Team Member = false they are considered an external user (i.e Client)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fwa8uJeZxqDmFbPrIwvSP%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.15.29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4a41eb08-3fbb-4773-ac8d-6c659d4b3799&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f8e007ff&sv=2)

You can show/hide elements of the UI by the **Type of User** using the following options

*   All Users types (Internal & External)
    
*   Internal Users only
    
*   External (Client) Users only
    

This can be useful to show only the most relevant sidebar items or sections on a record page to the logged in User. Decluttering improves the overall user experience within your app.

### 

**Visibility Setting: User Roles**

You may also show / hide UI elements to specific User Roles that you have setup in you app. By default Noloco creates a Team Admin and User role. You may create additional custom roles if you need to. Learn more about User Roles and Permissions in this guide [here](https://guides.noloco.io/users-and-permissions/user-access)

### 

Visibility Setting: **Custom Rules**

This is a very flexible visibility setting that allows you to define Record field criteria OR Logged in User criteria to determine when / if the UI element should be visible to the User.

You may also use multiple AND / OR custom rule statements for this visibility setting.

**Record Page**

On a record page, you can access the visibility settings for any component on the page. In the below screenshot example, a custom rule was setup to only display the Attachments block if the Loan purpose was 'First Time Buyer'.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FjY1G9Z211V6KReYX6fVX%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.36.56.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3De616c610-41af-4876-880e-6aab8456e69f&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=119f057b&sv=2)

**Collection View**

For an entire view (accessed via the Sidebar menu) you can decide which users can access it using custom rules and logged in User variables.

In the below screenshot example, a User boolean attribute called 'Credit Approval' is used to decide whether the Logged in User can access the Loan Applications area in the app.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FnkqufDXNTRBWAvfFGTm5%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.47.58.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D228f8468-82b7-45af-b02e-9b120955f634&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a03ad0e1&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FeqYhLvMZrvo16zzg5ZIY%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.47.46.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D07bbe956-5a43-4ed0-9b90-ec7331040665&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=3cbe6703&sv=2)

**Important: Do you use a User list?**

Remember if you are using a User list to sync users from an external data source, you must fetch Logged in User attributes via the relevant User list.

In the above scenario, if the Logged in User attribute you needed existed on the Borrowers User list you must select **Logged in User > Borrower > user (from Borrower) > Field Criteria e.g Credit Approval**

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FMtcnrXq86cICm9mN8vHJ%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252012.13.59.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D55ba3103-f2f6-442e-8d62-e02e6dfecad1&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=87b87d1b&sv=2)

### 

**Visibility Setting: Only show when conditions are met**

On a **Stages** element **on a record page,** you can conditionally show/hide values to the User dependent on record variables or logged in User variables.

A common use case for this feature is to only show a stage value when certain record fields have been completed to ensure good data hygiene within your app.

You may also use multiple AND / OR custom rule statements for this visibility setting.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FoxjWXSyPPcLv2BbpJ4KY%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.54.26.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D81353587-3add-4db5-9126-537dc15ff268&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=97f15c4a&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FcRwfOuIK7hci3u91GWSL%252FScreenshot%25202022-09-28%2520at%252009.55.12.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D89863da7-3cc3-47c3-817c-a3d8086c15db&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=1ac1347&sv=2)

### 

👁 Visibility vs 🔐 Security

When you use **visibility settings** to show some data but not other data, your app will still download whatever data it can for the corresponding collection, even if it is not displayed in the front-end UI of your app. It is relatively straightforward to inspect this data with common tools such as your browser's developer console, so you should not rely on visibility settings to keep your data secure.

Visibility settings are used to streamline the app's interface and user experience by only showing relevant sections to relevant users.

Use visibility conditions together with user access security features such as User Roles & Permissions if you wish to securely control which data users can access, and how the data is displayed.

# Hidden Field Values | Noloco

1.  [📃Record Pages](https://guides.noloco.io/record-pages)

Pass pre-defined values with hidden fields on Forms or Action Buttons

### 

Using Hidden Field Values in Noloco

Using Hidden Field Values in Noloco | Noloco Basics - YouTube

### 

Hidden vs Visible Field Values 👀

Noloco supports two types of fields:

*   visible input fields that the user fills in, or
    
*   hidden fields with pre-defined values when the form is submitted.
    

Hidden field values allow you to ensure specific data will always be added to a record. Two places you can make use of Hidden values are

*   Forms
    
*   Action buttons
    

### 

Static vs Dynamic Field Values ⚡️

You can pass either a **static value** or a **dynamic value** to a hidden field.

Examples of static values include pre-determined text, numeric or date data values that do not change.

e.g Whenever a new Loan Application record is created by a Borrower (User) via the '+New Loan Application' button to always pass a status value of 'Pending'.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FleiW4XxSSja4IMpxte1t%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252008.30.53.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D484d54b8-d5da-4f22-b3bf-3cba2f835967&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=66a479fd&sv=2)

Examples of dynamic values include passing values dependent on

*   The 'Logged in User' **and/or**
    
*   Relative Date/Time values.
    

This ensures that any value related to the logged in user submitting the Form or Action button **or** a relative date/time value will be added to the target record.

e.g Whenever a new Loan Application record is created by a Borrower (User) via the '+New Loan Application' button to always pass the `id` of the Borrower (Logged in User) to the Borrower field.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fus3ydXUcmClaqQpUZwOr%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252008.48.04.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Daf40fb57-a290-45d9-97f0-e1e1db1d4533&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=dc5daa16&sv=2)

**and/or**

Set the hidden value for 'Review Deadline Date' as `NOW`

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F8jCLMmOtuGcLILG2NS6D%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252008.42.47.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D80321d4d-98c6-447c-9961-09ff499b1150&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=29e5509f&sv=2)

Accessible from the (+) button > Navigate to 'Dates>' to see the available options

In both examples it will ensure the correct data is passed through to the record without putting the onus on the User that is interacting with the form. Reducing the number of steps for the User can reduce the level of friction from your User's experience.

**Note**: The field will not be displayed to the end user on the Form or the Action Button.

### 

👷‍♂️ For Builders: How to Configure a Hidden Value

**Where to access hidden values in Forms**

1.  Navigate to your chosen Collection to locate the respective Form
    
2.  Select the +New \[Colllection\] button
    
3.  When the form is open, enter into edit mode (Cmd+e) or (Ctrl+e)
    
4.  From the configuration view, select the field you wish to configure a hidden value for
    
5.  Navigate the the Hidden Value area
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fyq97zdll91Xvl48skotk%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252008.51.01.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbb98d3b8-b6a9-421c-80ab-f55ba7d9f651&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=9ab725d6&sv=2)

*   Pass either A) a static value or B) a dynamic value
    
    *   For static values enter (text, number, date etc.) or choose (single selection option) the value the dialog.
        
    *   **Note**: Keeping in mind the permitted data format for the target field
        
    
*   For dynamic values press the (+) button and access the Logged In User attributes you wish to pass through the field as a hidden value.
    
    *   **Note**: Choosing a related User Field that matches the target field
        
    

#### 

**ℹ️ Note for customers using a User List with their External Data Source**

*   **If you have setup a User List** and you wish to pass the id of the logged in User to the field on your form, **do not use the Noloco ID.** Instead use the **linked field ID** that matches that of the field you're configuring a hidden value for. This field should be available in the Logged in User attributes returned behind the (+) button.
    
    *   Example being: If you're passing the ID of the Borrower (user) to the Borrower field on the Loan Application form. You must select Logged in User > Borrower> Id and NOT Logged In User > id
        
    *   Screenshot example below
        
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FROgdjVl5mZ5NYfe5VyNU%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252008.43.40.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D3220fb53-9042-432e-a2cf-53d8edb20409&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=feb6ff96&sv=2)

**Where to access hidden values in Action Buttons**

*   Navigate to your chosen Collection you wish to configure an Action Button for
    
*   Enter into edit mode (Cmd+e) or (Ctrl+e) and click anywhere along the header of the page to open the view configuration sidebar
    
*   From the configuration sidebar, navigate to the button section
    
*   Choose to create a Collection button or a Record button
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FJzoN06DiriBv6XJSH64f%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252009.13.21.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D32ea3253-22a9-483e-ae57-9a4adc9ddfcc&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d8ea23d6&sv=2)

*   During the creation of your button, choose which fields you wish to include for the action
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fa5xloB5SOrEwE9mpeJrh%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252009.13.07.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2c211a1f-195a-489e-ae86-d5564d83583f&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=32f22c49&sv=2)

*   Select the field(s) you wish to configure a hidden value for
    
*   Navigate to the Hidden Value area
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FGyJtiK50oF3IMbzOxSD3%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252009.15.43.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Db1ae08d9-e04c-4783-a6b6-9147905ceb9f&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=1f7636ba&sv=2)

*   Pass either A) a static value or B) a dynamic value
    
    *   For static values enter (text, number, date etc.) or choose (single selection option) the value the dialog.
        
    *   **Note**: Keeping in mind the permitted data format for the target field
        
    
*   For dynamic values press the (+) button and access the Logged In User attributes you wish to pass through the field as a hidden value.
    
    *   **Note**: Choosing a related User Field that matches the target field
        
    

In the above screenshot example the **'Mark as Completed'** Action button is updating the Application status field value to Completed. All without requiring the User to input that field.

### 

Not to be confused with Input Field _Default_ Values

Default Values will remain visible on the Form view or Action Button view. It will pre-select data that the User is likely to choose by default, attempting to reduce friction in the User Experience.

However, it still gives the User the option to amend the selected input default field value before submitting the form or Action button.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FKusXYz11IbXfdJ4kUptN%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252010.57.28.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbc64a914-7453-4bc1-9f8a-391304f3c2e6&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a2c8ceb7&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FnWsX633zRAEm8QAsgOFO%252FScreenshot%25202022-08-15%2520at%252010.57.37.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dea5b6c0c-61f5-4d86-ba8c-3e9941c322d6&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=37c29e03&sv=2)

# Record Comments | Noloco

1.  [📃Record Pages](https://guides.noloco.io/record-pages)

Comment and collaborate on any record in Noloco

Record comments allow you, your users and your teammates to add comments to any record in your Noloco app regardless of data source.

To turn on record comments you need to enable the **Show record comments** switch on the configuration page of your record view.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FO43NXZIjgzugPAIVXRFy%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D8db016d9-841c-4351-ac9b-6289f99ff706&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=ef360091&sv=2)

Show record comments switch

Once you do that, Noloco will add the comments button and indicator to your record view's header

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FoNQVbS7yUmh3RrfkHiaO%252Freal-estate-sample.nolocolocal.dev_folder-1_interactions-clone_view_rec3gTfxmGyKEf5xt.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D74b6022d-5c49-4487-81b4-6e9c10a2da95&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=300c54a5&sv=2)

Record Comments button in the record view header

You can show the record comments by clicking the icon button in the record view header.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F3SCsLNaNOZPxNnO4PKVx%252Freal-estate-sample.nolocolocal.dev_folder-1_interactions-clone_view_rec3gTfxmGyKEf5xt%2520%282%29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da7376c96-5a90-49da-a810-3aaf020489c0&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=8a7b3c5&sv=2)

Noloco comments sidebar open in a record view

You can add comments to a record by typing into the text box at the bottom of the sidebar and sending your comment.

#### 

Formatting

You can format your message with **Bold**, _italic_ or `code` text, as well as add links, either automatically (by typing or pasting a link) or by converting other text to a link. You can also add ordered lists, unordered lists and code blocks for even richer comments.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FE6bNGh6xlQpBICrdzltD%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd2d6dc8c-773c-4893-ae92-d2cd9de50bd4&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a482ff34&sv=2)

Sample of a formatted comment

#### 

Attachments

You can attach as many files as you want to your comments which will then be displayed inline. Attachments are limited to a max size of 45mb and restricted to our list of supported file types.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F52M6lm7PVw5px43ynnip%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D40e87662-b876-45c8-b063-6d3bb5cf168f&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=15412723&sv=2)

#### 

Mentions

You can mention any other user (who you have permission to access) in a comment. To mention a user type the `@` key and then type the user's name and select them from the list.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fgh7Yfzdr8cw7dGMRvCNb%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dcb758003-8e59-4106-89dc-6f5e8bef532a&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=42436b89&sv=2)

@-mentions in Noloco Record comments

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FHKwpBylfqrDSSKFk0VkO%252Freal-estate-sample.nolocolocal.dev_folder-1_interactions-clone_view_rec3gTfxmGyKEf5xt%2520%284%29.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df702687c-2985-45bd-86b6-ffbe22687dec&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=9c4ef40b&sv=2)

### 

Internal Notes

There are often instances where we would like to ask questions or share thoughts on a task internally without your client being able to see them.

Any user with the 'Team Member' role attribute can send a record note, which remains exclusively visible to other users with the 'Team Member' role attribute, ensuring private team collaboration remains just that - private.

Whether strategizing on a project or discussing sensitive information, keep it internal and seamless with our new Internal Notes feature!

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FeLKYwrBOD7Aphc0sSdkE%252Finternal-notes.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da2a283d8-aca9-4c9f-b11a-f3575854a8c2&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=9f1e03e1&sv=2)

For now, comments are unable to be updated or deleted, even by app admins. If there is a comment (or set of comments) that you need to urgently remove or modify, please contact the support team.

### 

Notifications

When you add a new comment to a record, anyone who previously commented on a record, or anyone you mention in the comment will be notified by email and in-app notification. The notification will contain the comment text and a link to the record view with the comments sidebar open.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FLUw0eo1FoT2up5dAyLvC%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D2bb09577-b71d-4b31-84a5-6489175053d9&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=e3160200&sv=2)

It's possible to programmatically create record comments with Zapier or Make if you want to tag a record with a system-like message, or an audit trail. The process to programmatically create record comments is quite simple. For this example we will use Zapier, but the process is similar on Make.com

1.  First, log into Zapier or Make.com
    
2.  Create a new Zap
    
3.  Pick your trigger, this can be a Noloco Module, or something else, like when a Failed Payment happens in Stripe
    
4.  Next, choose "Noloco" as the App and choose `Create a New Record` as the Event
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F8LQ8Fgh8NOUA8DA1n2uT%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Def8c040a-1a45-4157-8c84-ed2260c51a96&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=cfbcbb42&sv=2)

1.  Choose the account and the app you're using
    
2.  For `Collection` choose `Comment`
    
    ![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FqIi1gzuZLt0MM3vSOm54%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Decac5ff7-103f-4d19-866b-f02d0afe78c7&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=a1d3f930&sv=2)
    
3.  Next, format the comment's `text` however you want. You can use newlines, and any markdown feature (except headings)
    
    ![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F1GVLRE6qUvATHVCgSwLS%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dd8561656-cf22-4dd7-9432-6935e1ae4a49&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=87ce6cbb&sv=2)
    
4.  The last, and most important step is to associate the comment with the correct record. You will need to fill in one of the last few values, which are named `{Table Name} Id` For example, if I wanted to attach my comment to a customer, it would be `Customer Id` and I would need to pass the Noloco Customer ID to that field. You might need to _Add a Search Step_ here.
    
    ![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fp0USPy7FDIS3At36UZCH%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D09e9c5db-9919-40ba-9907-384e4c8b29cd&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=536a1f1&sv=2)
    
5.  That's it - test your Zap and verify that your comment showed up on the record you expected it to.
    

The steps for Make.com are the same only the interface is different.

### 

Programmatic Mentions

If you want to mention a colleague or customer in a comment when creating comments programmatically, you can mention them by ID using this format `@[123]` where `123` is the Noloco User'd ID.

As mentioned above, any user mentioned in this way will be notified.

# Conditional Highlight Colors | Noloco

1.  [✏️Field Formatting](https://guides.noloco.io/field-formatting)

Find out how to conditionally highlight fields on your record pages based on field values and more

Conditional Highlights can allow you to change the of a field based on various conditions. Such as field values, logged-in user parameters and more.

They can be used in Highlight Sections on [Record Pages](https://guides.noloco.io/record-pages/overview).

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FelUJwHaIQhHXEJS6u8vq%252Fconditional-highlights.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D40908cd6-f842-41e8-b4ae-f12144129e63&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f4a31dc5&sv=2)

### 

**Setting Up Conditional Highlights**

To configure conditional highlights for a field, follow these steps:

1.  Navigate to the field's configuration settings within the Highlights section.
    
2.  Activate the option "Highlight this field based on conditions."
    
3.  You will be presented with a blank condition setup. Here, you can define the conditions under which the field should be highlighted, including choosing specific colors for different scenarios.
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F6oxgM1l7OeJuwVS388Lb%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-05%2520at%25202.25.56%25E2%2580%25AFp.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D72a6d9d8-7277-4c76-8eeb-cac4216997eb&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=b65b1977&sv=2)

### 

**Defining Conditions:**

*   **Select the Field**: Choose the field you wish to apply conditional highlighting to
    
*   **Choose an Operator**: Select the logical operator that will determine how the field value is evaluated (e.g., greater than, less than, equal to)
    
*   **Specify a Value**: If required, specify the value that will trigger the highlighting
    

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FpSqx9Q6buwzdrGHvW38Q%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-05%2520at%25202.28.53%25E2%2580%25AFp.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5437d6dd-c7dd-4b45-a4a4-371706edb092&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=dad14b18&sv=2)

For example, the rule below would conditionally highlight the cell. If the value of the "Leads" field, _is more than_ 20

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FVP7VFlLAEY3EqblIuunJ%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.21.28%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Df7157ac0-3fe3-42ef-a701-1acbf7c4d936&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=e03a60a4&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FytMFJfP6vS4a0lhcZcGx%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.24.14%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D54600289-b26b-4558-8940-c5342dcf768a&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=6234b3c4&sv=2)

### 

Multiple Highlight Conditions

You are not limited to just adding one rule on a condition. It is possible to apply multiple rules to a single field. Furthermore, leveraging "AND" and "OR" logical operators to enable complex conditions.

For example, you can change the color of a cell based on a field's value and also the _logged in user's role_. With the below conditions, the cell will only be highlighted _"Red"_, when the value of the "Leads" field _is less than 20_ AND the _logged in User is internal_.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FFN3Q6NFGjzwQI6kJEFIN%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.40.11%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D4bcc43aa-15bf-49c5-9025-3535fe2bac8c&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=5d806a4&sv=2)

Extending our example above, we can add more conditions to make the cell a different color. The cell will be highlighted "Red" if the "Leads" field _is less than or equal to_ 20

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FX09uLaQ43YOUsbr9WphO%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.55.15%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D14196e7f-3f79-4756-af6c-aa5ff9f0d241&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=93306884&sv=2)

It will turn "Orange" if the field _is greater than_ 20 AND _less than or equal to_ 60.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FdBhMYKO7PWdQf5Pai9zK%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.52.58%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dcc09e025-99f7-41c8-bb0a-a16d178c6e8f&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=579069b8&sv=2)

Finally, it will be "Green", if the value of the field _is greater than_ 60.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FxtBTYhKDg0Atcsn0FEJE%252FScreenshot%25202024-04-08%2520at%25209.53.06%25E2%2580%25AFa.m..jpg%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D95f1bb70-0ea2-4c76-8855-7932eaf4ce55&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d3443d5e&sv=2)

# Field visibility conditions | Noloco

1.  [✏️Field Formatting](https://guides.noloco.io/field-formatting)

Learn how to set field visibility conditions based on field values and logged in user parameters.

How to set field visibility conditions in your Noloco app - YouTube

Field visibility conditions allow you to define exact conditions for when a given field should be shown to app users. They can be used in several places:

*   Collection views
    
*   Record pages
    
*   Forms to add new records
    

In this video, learn how to set field visibility conditions based on field values and based on logged in user parameters to control when a particular field should be visible.

### 

Setup field conditions

To add new conditions to a field, open the field's configuration in either a _Details, Highlights_ or a _Form_.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FBiikQh5bFlhMWHdse7vJ%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D7cb73376-66ca-4727-8ef7-e64eb45216a8&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=af4b8ef9&sv=2)

Toggle **on** the "Only show when conditions are met" switch

This will add a blank condition to the field - the box grows to give you more space

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FXGvS3XqbOkUUwyThgzP6%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Ddf8efda5-72d5-4ef8-9cd7-7bf917c30850&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=f54c553&sv=2)

Choose a field, an operator and a value (if necessary) For example, this will hide the email field if its value is empty.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252Fuk8Z9WnaEChZdzHvevJB%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da66af835-af55-4ec8-95c1-1371b94a121c&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=23f8b040&sv=2)

Conditional fields respond immidately to changes to fields, which makes them great for implementing branching in forms, or changing how a record view is displayed.

For example, the following rule only shows the "Company" field if the email contains "@noloco.io" OR if the user is marked as _internal_

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FHc06oF4r2vGN9GbOZgo4%252Fimage.png%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3D5b47d2b4-edf6-4712-b92f-d3df1b8cf1d9&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=664eff2f&sv=2)

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252FGpWB1wHFsV6nbxbeQrsk%252Fconditional-field-gif-sm.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Da1efe4aa-6859-4241-9e63-e2f88f1c2fc8&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=d74047b6&sv=2)

### 

_Forms example_

_The below form hides several fields if_ status _is_ _**Cancelled**__,_ the logic being that there's no need to add house details such as number of beds, if the property is already cancelled.

![](https://guides.noloco.io/~gitbook/image?url=https%3A%2F%2F319575345-files.gitbook.io%2F%7E%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252F-MifpIQWu0HCVYAt51oT%252Fuploads%252F5sg7Zagz5OG8G8BZgokA%252Fconditional-form.gif%3Falt%3Dmedia%26token%3Dbf4f899e-35aa-4a86-923d-6209d8b87eb7&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=6873a73b&sv=2)
